chargeHist.descr: Posts or Publishes Private Representation w/out Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Edna M. Brunk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Edna M. Brunk is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Edna M. Brunk was found guilty of Posts or Publishes Private Representation w/out Consent, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 942.09(3m)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:36 p.m. Defendant Edna M Brunk in court.  Calling 16fo923 and 16cf07. Defendant states she lost her job at Taco Bell. Is now employed at Burger King. Got behind in her bills when unemployed. Defendant states she can begin minimum monthly payments. Court expects monthly payments before next review hearing. Adj. 3:39 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for October 22, 2018 at 03:00 pm.
Review hearing on June 18, 2018 at 03:00 pm.
No appearance or payment of fine, court orders warrant

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Voluntary appearance - Judge quashed warrant - not yet delivered to ONSO

1:46 p.m. Defendant Edna M. Brunk in court.  Calling 16cf07 and 16fo923. Court notes GAL fees owed in 13fa11. Defendant is working at Taco Bell for almost 1-1/2 years - works more than 40 hours per week  -100 hours every pay period; is now making $9.25 per hour. 805 E. Timber, Apt. 2. Pays $800 rent - no one shares rent expense with her. Defendant statement to placement of minor children; child support being withheld from paycheck. Defendant statement to finances; as $40 today to apply towards payment plan. Court accepts $40 payment - to be applied to GAL fees in 13fa11. Court recognizes defendant's attempts to establish work situation, placement of children and improvement in life situation. Court authorizes community service but doesn't want defendant to give up working hours to do community service. Court encourages some type of payment, even if nominal payments are made. Court will accept $10-$20 monthly payments. Court approves $30 monthly payment with Clerk of Court. If defendant makes regular monthly payments and contacts Branch 2 JA; next review hearing may be rescheduled/cancelled. Court quashes warrants. Adj. 2:03 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for April 16, 2018 at 03:00 pm.
No appearance or payment of fine, court orders warrant
made VA - notified Mary

1:21 p.m. Defendant Edna M. Brunk in court. Calling 16cf07 and 16fo923. Defendant states she finished probation in April - has had difficulties with finances and could not make payments-works at Taco Bell for one year. Defendant has $20 to pay today - wants to continue $50 payment plan that she had previously been on. Court quashes warrant. Court approves $50 payment beginning June 1, 2017. Review date remains. Adj.  Review hearing scheduled for October 2, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

TC from Ms. Brunk stating that she thought she missed her court appearance - she was informed that due to her non-appearance on 5/8/2017 a warrant was issued and she was given the option for a voluntary appearance. When she was informed that the warrant would remain active until the voluntary she began to swear at the JA so the phone call was ended.
No appearance or payment of fine, court orders warrant
terminated - regular

3:38 p.m. Defendant Edna M. Brunk in court. Calling 16fo923 and 16cf07. Court notes over $1000 balance due. Defendant states she works at Taco Bell - ended up in financial snafu - tried to set up payment plan - Clerk wanted $100 per month - can't afford - Court approves payment plan of $50 per month. Defendant states she has ability to make $50 payments. Adj. 3:41 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for May 8, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
from defendant

2:02 p.m. Defendant Edna M. Brunk in court in custody with attorney Richard John Shawl.  Calling 16fo923 (Review date for 12/5/16 in Branch 1) and 16cf07.  Court in receipt of defendant's letter and confusion with dates. Court quashes warrant and releases defendant from jail. Defendant states she can return to work. Defendant requests 1 payment for both cases. Court directs defendant to Clerk of Court to enter into payment plan for all cases. Branch 1 hearing date to remain. Adj. 2:06 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for January 9, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
per Nicole - in ONSO
No appearance or payment of fine, court orders warrant

1:42 p.m. Defendant Edna M. Brunk in court, in custody via video.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions defendant as to non-appearance. Defendant states she thought she wasn't supposed to show up for Court until September-was going to to call to get date. Court questions defendant as to payment. Defendant states she thought she had until September. Just had a baby. Employed at Taco Bell, since March. Defendant intends to pay $30 per paycheck until paid in full. Court informs Defendant to make $30 payments every check. Defendant states she will be in Friday to make payment. Court quashes warrant. Adj. 1:47 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for October 3, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
per Mary @ ONSO - in custody - ONSO
No appearance or payment of fine, court orders warrant

3:53 p.m. Defendant Edna M. Brunk in court with attorney Richard John Shawl.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Schiek states agreement. State moves to dismiss Count 1 - Granted. Defendant enters no contest plea. Plea questionnaire filed.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Schiek/Shawl/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing. Victim Impact Statement filed. 
Court Sentence
WHS/POP - 12 months CC to any current supervision
Fine - $200 plus costs for a total of $705.00
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
Supervision Fees
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).

Appeal rights given. Payment plan application given.
Adj. 4:08 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for July 11, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

11:42 a.m. Defendant Edna M. Brunk in court with attorney Richard John Shawl.  Steven M. Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Shawl statement that will be waiving preliminary.   Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. State to file Information within thirty days. Shawl waives right to arraignment within thirty days - Bail continued. Adj. 11:45 a.m.  Arraignment scheduled for April 26, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Bail continued. Adj. 2:35 p.m.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 11:45 am.

1:30 pm Defendant Edna M. Brunk in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - Schiek statement to bail - Court retains bond set. Adj. 1:33 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
